hackathon-description-text: Lincoln Financial Group’s third-annual hackathon-style event where students from
hackathon-requirements: In person hackathon - participants may use Devpost and will present their application on Sunday, 10/23
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=100 N Greene St, Greensboro, NC 27401, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
• Does the UI of the app look professional or is it sloppy?
• Is the application easy to use?
• Does the workflow of the app make sense & intuitive?
• Can application be administered by organizations with JA personnel with moderate technical expertise?

● Is the application technically viable? 
● To what degree does the application actually solve (some of) Junior Achievement's stated challenges? 
● Will they use this tool?

● Is the application technically viable? 
● Does the application approach a new problem, or look at an old problem in a new way (did the team think "out of the box")? 
● How clever or innovative was the approach the team used to build the project?

● Was the team able to explain their idea and what the app actually did?
● How was the quality and cohesiveness of the delivery presentation visuals and demonstration?

● Does the app work completely from start to finish?
● How many and how severe were any bugs encountered?
● Was anything in the app that wasn’t fully implemented?
● Did the team scope their app’s features well given the time frame of the Hackathon?
● The project is open-source or industry-leading (Apple/Google/.net), the data-set is open, team provided a good API support/documentation for others to pick up?

● App incorporates established strong security protocols ie: 2-factor auth
● App allows users to sign in with a federated login provider (Google, FB, Twitter)
● App accommodates items such as authenticate new account via email, automated password resets
● To what degree does the application technology actually solve the current problem?

● Application has multi-platform support (web / responsive / iOS / Android)
● The app uses the capabilities of the device it’s running on, for example location data through the GPS, biometric authentication, and motion sensors when appropriate.

● Is the app technically interesting or difficult?
● Were there real technical challenges to surmount?

hackathon-location-address: 100 N Greene St, Greensboro, NC 27401, USA
hackathon-description-header: Putting Technology to Work to Benefit North Carolina Communities
